text: as of today president putin is insisting
that what he describes as unfriendly
countries which is being taken to refer
to those nations lending support to
ukraine including many eu members will
have to pay for their gas supplies in
rubles and that comes after russia's
banking sector was hit by sanctions
several european governments including
germany have said they won't change
their method of payment even in the face
of what they say is blackmail
president biden says the u.s will
release a record amount of oil from its
strategic stockpiles to try to bring
down international prices
and the world trade organization has
halved its forecast for global trade
this year because of the war in ukraine
now in ukraine itself dozens of buses
are on standby to go to the besieged
city of mariupol in a fresh effort to
try to get civilians out and deliver
humanitarian aid the red cross says the
convoy's been delayed again after being
prevented from traveling on thursday
more than a hundred thousand people are
trapped in the city it's been under
heavy russian bombardment for weeks dan
johnson reports
this is what weeks of shelling has done
to mario paul home to four hundred
thousand people
its pleasant neighborhoods destroyed its
green avenues scarred its communities
surrounded bombarded and drained of life
this is the theater where hundreds died
trying to shelter
and now more families will scatter to
escape a port city that's become one of
the most dangerous places on earth a
major evacuation stalled again yesterday
is back on for this morning 45 ukrainian
buses are on their way
and the red cross says it is bringing
two trucks of humanitarian aid to the
besieged city where it's estimated 160
000 people are still trapped many
without food power or water
where can we go we're afraid can you
imagine living and walking among the
dead bodies
i no longer have a house
and i'm crying
i'm a man
and i have never cried in my life
ukraine's president said last night the
russian invaders had so much evil so
much thirst for destruction that they
reminded him of something otherworldly
monsters vladimir zelinski said who burn
and plunder and are bent on murder
the russian forces are paying a high
price and western intelligence says
vladimir putin's military is trying to
regroup resupply and reinforce
the uk ministry of defense believes the
kremlin's planning to send up to two
thousand troops from georgia to ukraine
and the head of the british armed forces
said the russian leader had already lost
the scenes coming out of maripo and
elsewhere are horrific
and the coming weeks will continue to be
very difficult
but in many ways putin has already lost
far from being the far-sighted
manipulator of events that he would have
us believe
putin has damaged himself through a
series of catastrophic misjudgments
meanwhile in moscow president putin's
threatened to cut gas supplies from
today unless countries pay in rubles
germany france and austria have rejected
his demand saying it amounts to
blackmail
it's being seen as a desperate attempt
to shore up the russian currency which
has struggled under the weight of
western sanctions
in mario paul there's another chance to
reach safety but it's been offered
before then snatched away as evacuation
plans collapsed people here are weary
they're fearful and their main hope is
leaving this devastation behind
dan johnson bbc
news well the uk's ministry of defense
has given its daily update on what's
going on in ukraine here's its latest
tweet it says ukrainian forces are
advancing around cheniev and have
retaken two villages on the supply route
linking that city to kiev from russian
forces it adds that there have been what
it says were successful but limited
counter-attacks to the north and east of
kiev and it concludes that both kiev and
chenniev have been subjected to
continued air and missile strikes
despite russian claims of reducing their
military activity in those areas
well let's get more and talk to our
correspondent emma vardy who's in liv in
western ukraine and emma let's just talk
about what is going on in mario paul
that port in the south that's been
bombarded four weeks there was supposed
to be a ceasefire yesterday allowing a
convoy to go in and help people to get
out what do we know about where that is
and what's happening today
well there is still hope that buses will
be able to continue on to the city today
that possibly that evacuation can
finally happen there was a convoy of 45
buses which the red cross says is still
on hold at the moment they haven't got
the security guarantees that are needed
there's another set of buses it's hoped
will be able to continue on to the city
but there was this setback
last night the ukrainian deputy prime
minister saying look a load of those
buses were already held up
at a russian checkpoint some three hours
away from the city so it does seem like
potential for other another stalled
effort of course there's been failed
attempts previously for there to be safe
routes out ukrainian government saying
that russian forces have been shelling
some of those corridors something moscow
denies so everyone waiting and watching
really to see if this humanitarian
crisis can be brought to an end it is a
really desperate situation there still
as we've been hearing up to 170 000
people
still trapped there have been a few
people who have been able to escape the
bbc has caught up with in recent days
telling terrible stories of so much of
the city just in devastation and people
with awful stories of watching death and
destruction in front of their eyes so
one can only imagine how people are
feeling those people still trapped there
so all eyes today will be on those
efforts by those buses to see if there
can be progress
in people escaping from the city
